pr_title: [Cross Client Batching LeaderTimes - 2b] | MultiClientConjureTimelockService Dialogue Clients

timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: This shouldn't depend on the concrete type
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: Remove responsibilty of concrete class from DialogueServiceProvider
Add change so previous commit makes sense

timeline.bodyText: IntelliJ says this can be package-private, so please do so.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: I think I understand why we need the impl, but not the interface - I feel like this is a very specific interface (where I'd rather there is a more generic interface and AMCCTS is one of the implementations). Regardless, this is also possibly a misleading name: this always passes a token that is "Bearer omitted", which while technically is on the theme of authentication, feels a bit odd to call this an authenticating service.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@

+package com.palantir.lock.client;
+
+import com.palantir.atlasdb.timelock.api.LeaderTimes;
+import com.palantir.atlasdb.timelock.api.Namespace;
+import java.util.Set;
+
+public interface AuthenticatingMultiClientConjureTimelockService {

replies.bodyText: I wouldn't name this in this way: users elsewhere in the AtlasDB client code shouldn't need to know that authentication (or the lack thereof!) is a thing that's happening beyond this layer, which is an implementation detail. Conceptually this interface should be something like InternalMultiClientConjureTimelockService (possibly not a great name) and then your AuthMCCTSImpl should be AuthIMCCTS (or even UnauthedIMCCTS).
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: I hit a mental block in trying to come up with a name for this interface, InternalMultiClientConjureTimelockService is reasonable.
replies.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: nit: sorry for confusion, AuthIMCCTS was just used as a short-hand, I'd prefer we use either Authenticated or Unauthenticated in full rather than Auth, which doesn't say much
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
